column4: Hey guys... beginner question. I'm preparing to load Ubuntu 8.10 from an iso on a PC already loaded with XP, when I get to the setup, and I drag to create space for Ubuntu, how do I know it won't delete any info used by XP?
mib: Would it be helpful to defrag first, to get it all together? Is there a safe way to do it, other than fresh installing both and partitioning?
by installing that way, it will only create a big file inside windows, it won't resize a partition nor delete anything. So it shouldn't break anything
forget what I just said. It seemed to me that you were installing with Wubi
